subject: Creativity
title: The Creativity Quotient: Can We Score It Like IQ?
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Creativity Quotient: Can We Score It Like IQ?.

hook.text: IQ has a single number. Can creativity get one too? Researchers have been trying for decades.

buildup.text: The Creativity Quotient (CQ) attempts to combine divergent thinking, domain expertise, and motivation scores.

discovery.text: Unlike IQ, creativity is domain-specific â€” a musical genius may score low on verbal creativity tests.

twist.text: No single test captures creativity. It requires measuring multiple dimensions across multiple domains.

climax.text: Most researchers now agree: creativity is too multidimensional for a single number. CQ remains elusive.

punchline.text: Creativity refuses to be reduced to a single number. That's fitting.

quiz.question: Why is a single 'Creativity Quotient' difficult to create?
options: Creativity is too multidimensional and domain-specific
